Talk_1012:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>If you don't rent one here, you won't
have another chance until you reach
<clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>.
And if you're thinking of crossing the vast
Gerudo Desert, well, sand-seal surfing is
a great way to travel!
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Greeting_01>Renting a sand seal costs <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Or, if you're interested in a sleigh seal—
a sand seal with a carrier—it's <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff>!
talk0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>I could go into detail, but really the best
way to learn is by doing it!
talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>That's the difference you get if you rent
a trained sand seal! Ours have a great
temperament and are easy to control.
Renting one would be a deal at twice
the price!
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hey now! You aren't thinking of going and
catching a wild sand seal after I explain
things, are you?
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I mean, if you did, you'd have to contend
with their <clr:0000>exceptional senses<clr:ffff>. They easily
startle at slight <clr:0000>sounds and tremors<clr:ffff>...
Unless you're really, really sneaky, they'll
run away the moment they notice you.<sp:5:1:0>
And even then...
untether from one you've caught, and
it'll be gone faster than you can say
"I should have rented from Kohm!"
SunaTalk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Admiration>If you're having trouble surfing with a
shield, try removing any attachments.
Or you can just use a different shield.
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>It's not enough that the intense desert
days and freezing desert nights have
reached Gerudo Canyon...
Thanks to that <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff>, there hasn't
been any business here at all.
SunaTalk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:QuestionNormal_00>What do you need? If it's a shield, I think
you have plenty in your pouch already.

I don't think you need one from me. Talk
to me after you equip one of the ones you
already have.
Talk_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>What do you say? Interested?


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Renting a sand seal costs <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Or, if you're interested in a sleigh seal—
a sand seal with a carrier—it's <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff>!
talk0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>Once you're all hooked up, the rest is
easy! Just <clr:0000>guide<clr:ffff> the sand seal in the
direction you want to go!
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:CustomVasaaq_00>Vasaaq!<sp:5:0:0> It looks like the desert day is
shaping up to be another scorcher!
talk0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:CustomVasaaq_00>Vasaaq!<sp:5:0:0> It's impressive that you're out
and about in this heat!
talk0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:CustomVasaaq_00>Vasaaq! The chilly nights here really are
something, aren't they?
Talk_1004:
<sp:3:0:2:0200>There is no amount of money that will
convince me to lend one of my sand seals
to a member of the Yiga Clan.
I will absolutely not help you cross
the desert.
Talk_1022:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>Many travelers have set out into the
desert only to discover how quickly their
feet sink into the dunes.
If you're thinking of crossing the vast
Gerudo Desert, make it easy on yourself
and go <clr:0000>sand-seal surfing<clr:ffff> instead!
What do you say? Interested?


<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Greeting_01>Renting a sand seal costs <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Or, if you're interested in a sleigh seal—
a sand seal with a carrier—it's <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff>!
talk0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Oh? Are you sure?


The <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> has made crossing the
desert even more dangerous than normal,
you know.
talk0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>It's not enough that the intense desert
days and freezing desert nights have
reached Gerudo Canyon...
But then the <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> appeared and
really drove away potential customers.
No one wanted to go out in that mess.
talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:CustomVasaaq_00>Vasaaq!


I can't help but smile whenever I've got
customers, whether it's one or a hundred!
talk0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Oh? Are you sure?


The <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> may be gone, but
crossing the desert still isn't something
for the faint of heart!
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>If you're interested in <clr:0000>sand seals<clr:ffff>, then
you're in the right place!

Sand seals are animals that can cruise
easily through the desert, and this <clr:0000>shop<clr:ffff>
is where we rent them to travelers!
Many travelers embark on journeys into
the desert only to discover how quickly
their feet sink into the dunes.
So if you're thinking of crossing the
desert, you should make it easy on
yourself and go <clr:0000>sand-seal surfing<clr:ffff> instead!
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Greeting_01>Renting a sand seal costs <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Or, if you're interested in a sleigh seal—
a sand seal with a carrier—it's <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff>!
talk0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:CustomVasaaq_00>Vasaaq!


I can't help but smile whenever I've
got customers!
SunaTalk00:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Did you want to rent a sand seal?
Or maybe a sleigh seal?
SunaTalk01:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Hold on a second. Where's your shield?
Shields are key to sand-seal surfing,
you know!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I can throw in a shield if you want!
It'd bring the total price to <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff>.
What do you say?
SunaTalk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad>Hm. It looks like you can't afford this
right now...

<sp:3:0:2:0300>It isn't cheap to train and take care of
sand seals.<sp:5:0:0> If you can't pay the rental fee,
you'll have to walk...
SunaTalk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Sarqso!


Oh! Don't forget that they're called sand
seals for a reason! Watch out for rocky
areas, OK?
